document.docAuthor: Soto, Eduardo M. & Ramírez, Martín J.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philisca huapi
Ramírez, 2003: 183
(male holotype from Argentina , Neuquén province , Nahuel Huapi Natl. Park, Puerto Blest , Laguna Los Cántaros , ca. 41.8009°S, 71.8509°W,
30.I.1985
, M. Ramírez , 9818, and female paratype from Puerto Blest , trail to Lago Ortiz Basualdo ,
I.1990
, M. Ramírez , deposited in MACN-Ar, reexamined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: It resembles other species of the
ornata
group by the modified male chelicerae and the epigyne with smooth, heart shaped median field close to the epigastric furrow ( Figs 34f , 11b, c ). It can be distinguished by lacking the lateral projections on the male endites and by the long, straight ducts of the female accessory bulbs.
Description: Male and female are described in Ramírez (2003) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Philisca huapi Ramírez
(MACN-Ar 14819). a–c female ( a dorsal habitus; b epigyne, ventral view; c cleared epigyne, dorsal view); d–e male left bulb ( d ventral view; e same, retrolateral view). (AB: accessory bulbs, CD: copulatory ducts, MF: median field, S: spermathecae).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: Humid southern forest in Chile , from Malleco to Palena provinces; in Argentina only collected in
Puerto Blest and Termas de Epulaufquen, two humid Andean passes at the Chilean border ( Fig. 38f , Ramírez 2003 ).
